page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area consists of most of Elmore, and part of Longney and Hardwicke. Most of it is rural, with a strong farming community. The Gloucester and Sharpness Canal and the River Severn (famous for the Severn Bore) run through the area and also marks the divide between the rural community and a large housing estate at Hardwicke. Much of the land either is or has been owned by the Guise family, who now reside at Elmore Court (well worth a visit). Most types of people were interviewed-including farmers, villagers and comparative newcomers to the area. We found some interesting houses-many going back to the 17th and 18th centuries. Many are of timber construction, with wattle and daub. Many also have thatched roofs.
